figure_1: A flow chart of the pharmacy honours program showing how students are assessed (assessment weighting) and how final overall honours grades are calculated
figure_2: A histogram of the frequency of overall honours marks; a mark of 90 and above is Honours Class 1 and eligible for university medal, a mark of 85–89 is Honours Class 1, a mark of 80–84 is Honours Class 2 Division 1, and a mark of 75–79 is Honours Class 2 Division 2
figure_3: Correlation between student’s weighted average mark (WAM) on entry to honours against their overall performance in honours
figure_4: Correlation between student’s performance in semester 1 (PHAR4815; research coursework) against their performance in semester 2 (PHAR4830; research project)
